Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there was no record of an arrest, trial, or incarceration of anyone named Xi Ping Chow in New York City in June 2017.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that a 57-year-old Chinese immigrant was arrested for selling dog meat in New York City, when in reality, there was no evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there are no corroborating media reports or official statements from the New York Police Department to verify the arrest.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the arrest of a Chinese immigrant for selling dog meat is a common occurrence, perpetuating a racially charged urban legend without sufficient evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation for the claim is that it was a fabricated story published by World News Daily Report, which has a history of publishing entirely false stories.
